title: "Hey guys we can't nerf lee sin because of community backlash"
body:
one veigar nerf later

community responds with massive backlash on boards and reddit

"sorry guys, but these changes are LOCKED. This is only way to make veigar a healthy and balanced champion"

http://i.imgur.com/OTnmpA3.gif

His position in the meta dictates changes to other champions in an attempt to bring other champs up to his level.

Funny thought, may have no bearing at all.
This would work if other champs were getting buffed instead of nerfed.

I've seen some up and down.
Changing a targetted skill to a skillshot is not necessarily a nerf. 
The inherent weakness of targeted abilities is that activating them from outside of their cast range makes your champ move into cast range - this can result in chasing a moving target into a less favorable position.
There is also the benefit that skillshots can be flung into bushes and at invisible enemies (if you know where they are or just want to check).

I am strictly looking at the changes to Veigar's Baleful Strike with these examples. But they are not dissimilar to changes I've witnessed in other champs recently.

They want him nerfed because:
1. he never gets any meaningful nerfs
2. in competitive, he's in every game. In worlds 2014, he was the most picked/banned champion next to alistar (who had that bug where he could autoattack on headbutt which was why he was 100% pick/ban)
3. he counters the entire tank jungler role. At high levels of play, amumu, fiddlesticks and naut are all considered unviable because lee sin exists.
4. he's a generalist champion who can do everything, and while he can't do everything better than everyone, he's a safepick due to his intense mobility. That being said, his mobility was never really complained about until season 4 when the trinket wards showed up and Lee sin suddenly got a free dash. Yes he is just as mobile now as he was before season 4, but Lee actually had to pay for it back then. 75 gold or 800 gold for the sightstone if Lee wanted to get that mobility.

Well I see many problems with your statements. For one, Lee Sin doesn't need any nerfs. He has been gutted so many times in the past that right now I feel like his kit is as balanced it will ever be. Yes it looks OP on paper, but in reality it isn't. Id rather have Sej, Panth, Vi, J4, or Fiddlesticks on my team then Lee Sin. Their mid and late game is better, and their early game is also comparatively close to lee's with the exception of fiddles. Yes he is seen a lot in the LCS, but does that really mean he needs a nerf? Lee Sin has nothing to do with why those junglers are played at high levels. It has everything to do with the fact that bruiser and mobile junglers are the meta this season, bc every other lane, favors mobility. Yes I understand it's frustrating that lee has so much mobility in his Q and W, but if he didn't, why even bother picking lee? Theres a reason Riot wont nerf lee. It's not because he is their poster boy or anything, but it's because he is the fall back jungler for everyone. Every lane has one of these, a fall back champion. Lee is strong, but nowhere near op.

People are finally sick to death of seeing the same broken design over and over again in every other game they've played almost since he was released. It's not so much about fotm. It's about the fact that he specifically has never *not* been fotm.
But the thing is, it's not broken. If it was broken, Lee would be on permaban status, which he is not. If he was broken, Riot would nerf him like they've done every champion.

Riot was going to nerf him, but Lee Sin fanboys like you complained about it, so they got reverted, twice actually, once was removal of ward hopping, and one was a kit rebalance. No other champion ever got this treatment, and this is why everybody is pissed.

> has never not been fotm.

That's because he is a fun champion to play, is that so hard to comprehend?  Yes, he's annoyingly mobile, has a crazy kit, and can fill just about every roll, but he's fun and exciting to play. He's not some boring right click faceroll champ, he's a thrilling, enojoyable champion to play.

You can have fun champions, but a champion does not need an overloaded, overpowered kit to be fun.  Lee Sin's kit is pretty overloaded, and fairly overpowered, for a generalist.  I expect that level of power to be found on specialist champions, you know, those that have a niche and are rather sucky outside the niche?  At the very least, I expect Lee Sin to have his spell vamp removed, be unable to hop to un-upgraded trinket wards (so he has to either buy a ward, upgrade the trinket, or buy a sightstone), and receive a hard nerf to the percentage damage of his ultimate.  It's not very fun getting one shot by Lee Sin WITHOUT taking a critical hit or Lee Sin building full damage.
